page.title: 01WEST BILNEY, CARRSTONE & FEN
page.content: Open, gently undulating greens and countryside, large fields with some hedges removed and forestry. Some small areas of deciduous woodland remain, Carrstone quarried until recently, leaving pits, whose future use is being discussed. Gravel is quarried and much of this land is bring relandscaped by Hoveringhams who recently won a prize for their efforts. Migrating water birds now use these flooded areas in large number. A very rural area, half the block only accessable by farmtracks. Agriculture is the main industry, mainly cereals and root vegetables. Each farmer jad special diversification, cattle, sheep,rhubarb, daffodils, turkey rearing and rootstocks for roses scattered houses, those in the centre of the block originally estate housing for West Bilney Hall.
